text: Johanna Quandt (21 June 1926 â€“ 3 August 2015) was the German widow of industrialist Herbert Quandt, who saved BMW from bankruptcy. As a result, she was the 8th richest person in Germany, 82nd in the world and 11th richest woman according to Forbes. As of August 2014, the Quandt family is estimated to be worth $46.3 billion.The World's Billionaires: Germany. forbes.com, retrieved 5 August 2015 She died at the age of 89 in her home in Bad Homburg near Frankfurt.Johanna Quandt, Billionaire Matriarch of BMW Clan, Dies at 89. forbes.com, retrieved 5 August 2015 ==References== Category:1926 births Category:2015 deaths Category:German billionaires Category:German businesspeople Category:People from Berlin
title: Johanna Quandt
